name: Deinonychus
description: An agile pack hunter with deadly sickle claws on its hind feet. Excels at dealing critical damage and coordinated attacks.
scientificFacts: Deinonychus means 'terrible claw', named after its distinctive enlarged claw on each foot.
Discovery of Deinonychus in the 1960s revolutionized how scientists viewed dinosaurs, suggesting they were active and agile rather than slow and sluggish.
Evidence suggests Deinonychus had feathers, used for display and possibly insulation.
The enlarged claw on each foot could slice with tremendous force, potentially held retracted while running like modern birds of prey.
Fossil evidence suggests they hunted in coordinated packs, similar to modern wolves.

name: Ankylosaurus
description: A heavily armored tank covered in bony plates with a devastating tail club. High defense and counter-attack specialist.
scientificFacts: Ankylosaurus had a tail club that could swing with enough force to break bones, generating approximately 14,000 Newtons of force.
Its body was covered in osteoderms - bony deposits forming plates and spikes embedded in the skin.
Even its eyelids had armored shutters to protect against attacks.
Despite its heavy armor, recent studies suggest Ankylosaurus could move at speeds up to 6 mph when needed.
It was one of the last dinosaurs before the K-Pg extinction event 66 million years ago.

name: Pteranodon
description: A flying reptile (not technically a dinosaur!) that serves as scout and hit-and-run specialist. Can reveal upcoming encounters and escape danger.
scientificFacts: Pteranodon was not actually a dinosaur, but a pterosaur - a flying reptile that lived alongside dinosaurs.
With a wingspan of up to 7 meters (23 feet), it was one of the largest flying animals of all time.
The distinctive head crest may have been used for steering during flight or for display.
Pteranodon was likely a piscivore, feeding primarily on fish by skimming the ocean surface.
Despite its large size, it was very lightweight - hollow bones kept its weight to about 25 kg.

name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
description: The ultimate apex predator. Devastating damage output but slow and resource-intensive. Unlocked by reaching depth 5.
scientificFacts: T. rex had the strongest bite force of any land animal, estimated at 12,800 pounds (57,000 Newtons).
Recent discoveries suggest T. rex may have been partially covered in feathers, at least as juveniles.
Its tiny arms were actually incredibly strong, capable of lifting 400 pounds each.
T. rex had binocular vision and an excellent sense of smell, making it a formidable hunter.
It lived exclusively in what is now western North America, in forests and open plains.
